data.author: Willis Player
data.quote: A liberal is a person whose interests aren't at stake at the moment.

data.author: Gordon Parks
data.quote: The guy who takes a chance, who walks the line between the known and unknown, who is unafraid of failure, will succeed.

data.author: Margaret Thatcher
data.quote: I am extraordinarily patient, provided I get my own way in the end.

data.author: Thomas Jefferson
data.quote: Never trouble another for what you can do for yourself.

data.author: Brian Adams
data.quote: Stephen Colbert, The Colbert Report Learn the art of patience. Apply discipline to your thoughts when they become anxious over the outcome of a goal. Impatience breeds anxiety, fear, discouragement and failure. Patience creates confidence, decisiveness, and a rational outlook, which eventually leads to success.

data.author: John Cage
data.quote: - More quotations on: [Patience] I can't understand why people are frightened of new ideas. I'm frightened of the old ones.

data.author: John Green
data.quote: When I was in college, I remember fearing that the dreary grind of adulthood would feature infinitely more existential dread than frat parties had, but the opposite has been true for me. I'm much less likely to feel that gnawing fear of aimlessness and nihilism than I used to be and that's partly because education gave me job opportunities, but it's mostly because education gave me perspective and context.

data.author: Scott Westerfeld
data.quote: Everyone in the world was programmed by the place they were born, hemmed in by their beliefs, but you had to at least try to grow your own brain

data.author: Albert Szent-Gyorgyi
data.quote: A discovery is said to be an accident meeting a prepared mind.

data.author: Charles Lamb
data.quote: Lawyers, I suppose, were children once.

data.author: P. J. O'Rourke
data.quote: Always read stuff that will make you look good if you die in the middle of it.
